turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I need to schedule an appointment with Dr. Emily Carter. I've been trying to call for days, but I keep getting stuck in a phone queue!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I can certainly help with that. Can you please provide your full name and date of birth to verify your identity?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's John Smith, and my birthday is January 15, 1988.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Mr. Smith. I see you in our system. What is the reason for your visit today?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's for my annual physical. Also, I've been feeling more tired than usual lately, so maybe some blood work too?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I've noted that. Dr. Carter has availability on Tuesday, November 7th at 10:00 AM or Thursday, November 9th at 2:30 PM. Would either of those times work for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, November 7th is better, but 10:00 AM is a bit early. Do you have anything a little later that day?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Let me check. On November 7th, the only other available slot with Dr. Carter is at 3:00 PM. Alternatively, Dr. Miller has an opening at 11:00 AM on the 7th. Would you like either of those options?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'll take the November 7th at 3:00 PM with Dr. Carter. Also, out of curiosity, why is it so hard to get through on the phone? Is the office understaffed?
